document_data.mainbody:
The Bakers Daughter was a love song about a silver dragon falling in love with a mortal woman, written and popularized sometime before 1368 DR.
In 1368 DR, the Bakers Daughter was performed by the god Milil, the Lord of All Songs. He imposed the beautiful song on an audience of Sensates from Sigil who were performing a scrying ritual to experience the forbidden experience of spying on Torillian deities.
